result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Andrew Moore in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Andrew Moore is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Andrew Moore

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Case DISMISSED.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Michael Andrew Moore not in court, in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense is requesting Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants request and sets 09/21/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report - 05-16-2022
Pretrial Services Violation Report  received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 09CF2607 & 21CF2817. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Milone.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Request For Substitution

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on an active scene. Defense objects to an adjournment and moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Andrew Moore
Current: 2221 N 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2022)
Prior: 815 West Wright Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Andrew Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
